intro: Cerastium saxatile, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its compact growth form helps it withstand harsh weather and limited nutrients. Cerastium saxatile is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and Asia.
